segments.text: I notice a boy climbing the wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar with pure determination.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His little fingers just barely grasp the edge, and I can't help but admire his bravery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But oh, that stool looks so unstable; it could tip any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister stands nearby, looking up at him expectantly, and it's almost a picture of innocent mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their cooperation brings a smile to my face, but I feel a nagging sense of dread.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could just shout at them to get down, to be careful, but I don’t want to break the moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Isn’t childhood supposed to be full of these little adventures, even if they are risky?
segments.speaker: PAR
